result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Unger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with full huber privileges, 0 days credit.
Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with full huber privileges, 0 days credit, CONCURRENT to Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin J Unger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin J Unger in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  
Student Intern Daniel Murphy supervised by Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  

COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with full huber privileges, 0 days credit.
COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with full huber privileges, 0 days credit, CONCURRENT to Count 1.

The Court STAYS THESE SENTENCES UNTIL 4-15-16, 5pm.

The Court further orders the defendant to:
- Provide a DNA sample.; pay surcharge;
- Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) within 1 year (by 4-4-17); any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment; 

Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  
Defendant advised of his right to appeal this sentence.
Filed:  
-Sentencing Referral Form;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS GPS Modification as follows: release on Saturday and Sunday to attend funeral services for defendant's uncle.
Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing in Branch 22 on 04/04/2016 at 8:30am.

Defendant Benjamin J Unger in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Zach Wittchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  GPS monitoring is amended to allow release for verified dental appointments.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for sentencing on 04/04/2016 at 8:30am.

Defendant Benjamin J Unger in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of today's proceedings. State does not object. Court will set trial date if case is not resolved at the next court date. Court will take Case No. 15CT2304 for global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin J Unger in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned to Br. 22.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Benjamin J Unger in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Counts 1 & 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
